name: Alsace Sylvaner
tastingNotes: Light and fresh Alsatian white. Crisp and easy-drinking.
aromaNotes: Green apple, citrus, white flowers, herbs
foodPairings: Seafood; salads; light fare; aperitif
notes: Fresh Alsatian Sylvaner for easy everyday drinking

name: Alsace Grand Cru Praelatenberg Riesling
tastingNotes: Mineral and elegant with fine acidity. L'inoubliable cuvée from single Grand Cru vineyard.
aromaNotes: Citrus, white flowers, petrol, minerals, stone fruit
foodPairings: Seafood, choucroute, foie gras, Asian cuisine, aged cheeses
notes: Grand Cru Praelatenberg from prestigious Alsace vineyard. Exceptional terroir expression

name: Alsace Grand Cru Steinklotz Riesling
tastingNotes: Dry, mineral-driven Grand Cru Riesling with high acidity and strong aging potential.
aromaNotes: Citrus, green apple, white flowers, mineral, petrol hints with age.
foodPairings: Seafood; shellfish; choucroute; Asian cuisine; aged cheeses.

name: Alsace Riesling
tastingNotes: Dry Riesling with minerality and elegant salinity. Aged on fine lees. Fresh and precise with good aging potential.
aromaNotes: Citrus, green apple, mineral, petrol hints, white flowers
foodPairings: Choucroute; fish; shellfish; Asian cuisine; goat cheese
notes: From Marlenheim in Alsace. Dry style (Sec). Serve at 8-10°C. Classic Alsatian Riesling with excellent food pairing versatility

name: Saint-Amour
tastingNotes: Elegant Beaujolais cru. Fresh and fruity with floral notes.
aromaNotes: Strawberry, cherry, rose, violet, spice
foodPairings: Charcuterie; roast chicken; soft cheeses; light fare
notes: Beaujolais cru Saint-Amour - one of 10 cru villages

name: Bergerac
tastingNotes: Bordeaux-style blend from Dordogne. Smooth and approachable.
aromaNotes: Plum, blackcurrant, herbs, cedar
foodPairings: Duck; grilled meats; charcuterie; aged cheeses

name: Bordeaux Supérieur
tastingNotes: Right-bank–leaning Bordeaux Supérieur style with ripe dark fruit, moderate tannins, and a classic savory finish.
aromaNotes: Blackcurrant, plum, cedar, dried herbs.
foodPairings: Roast meats; burgers; stews; hard cheeses.

name: Margaux
grapeVarieties: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot
tastingNotes: Margaux with refined tannins and cassis-driven fruit; classic Médoc structure with aging potential.
aromaNotes: Blackcurrant, cedar, graphite, violets, tobacco.
foodPairings: Roast lamb; steak; duck; aged cheeses.

name: Bordeaux Rosé
tastingNotes: Fresh and fruity rosé. Light and refreshing summer wine.
aromaNotes: Strawberry, citrus, white flowers, melon
foodPairings: Salads; seafood; light fare; aperitif

name: Bourgogne Hautes-Côtes de Nuits
tastingNotes: Elegant Burgundian Pinot Noir. Fresh red fruits with subtle earthiness. Refined and food-friendly.
aromaNotes: Red cherry, raspberry, earth, subtle oak, violets
foodPairings: Roast chicken; duck; salmon; mushrooms; soft cheeses
notes: Producer not visible on label. Classic Burgundy red from elevated Côte de Nuits vineyards

name: Santenay “Les Vieilles Vignes”
tastingNotes: Red-fruited Burgundian Pinot Noir with floral lift and gentle earth; vibrant acidity and fine tannins.
aromaNotes: Cherry, raspberry, rose, forest floor, subtle spice.
foodPairings: Roast chicken; duck; mushrooms; salmon; soft cheeses.

name: Cahors Malbec
tastingNotes: Dark and inky from Cahors. Rustic and powerful with French terroir.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, violet, leather, tobacco

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Pays d'Oc
tastingNotes: Value-driven southern French Cabernet. Ripe fruit with approachable style.
aromaNotes: Blackcurrant, cherry, cedar, herbs
foodPairings: Grilled meats; burgers; pasta; casual dining

name: Saumur-Champigny Val de Loire
tastingNotes: Loire Valley Cabernet Franc. Fresh and elegant with herbal character.
aromaNotes: Raspberry, bell pepper, violet, herbs, graphite
foodPairings: Grilled meats; charcuterie; goat cheese; roast poultry
notes: Producer not visible on label. Loire Valley Cabernet Franc

name: Madiran
tastingNotes: Powerful and tannic from southwest France. Requires aging to soften.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, leather, tobacco, spice, tar
foodPairings: Duck; game; braised meats; aged hard cheeses
notes: Clos Saint-Martin Madiran from southwest France. Tannat-based wine needs aging

name: Les Hospitaliers Côtes du Rhône Villages Visan
appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages Visan AOC
tastingNotes: Organic Southern Rhône blend with rich fruit and spice. Smooth tannins with Mediterranean character.

notes: Organic wine (FR-BIO-01). Founded in 1318

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
tastingNotes: Full-flavored with soft tannins. Excellent value everyday wine.
aromaNotes: Plum, cherry, herbs, spice
foodPairings: Pasta with meat sauce; grilled meats; pizza; aged cheeses

name: Trinità Montepulciano d’Abruzzo Riserva
tastingNotes: Matured Montepulciano Riserva with dark fruit, spice, and integrated oak; structured and savory.
aromaNotes: Plum, black cherry, leather, tobacco, spice.
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich pasta.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riserva
tastingNotes: Extended aging brings complexity. Rich and structured with good depth.
aromaNotes: Plum, cherry, leather, tobacco, spice
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich pasta dishes
notes: Producer not visible on label. Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riserva with extended aging

aromaNotes: Citrus, white flowers, mineral, herbs

aromaNotes: Cherry, wild berries, herbs, sea breeze, spice.

notes: Mastroberardino is Campania's most historic producer. Lacryma Christi from Vesuvius slopes

tastingNotes: Historic southern Italian red with ripe dark fruit and savory spice; structured and age-worthy.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, dried herbs, spice.
foodPairings: Roast meats; braises; hard cheeses.

tastingNotes: Powerful and structured. One of southern Italy's greatest grapes with exceptional aging potential.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, tar, spice
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich stews

tastingNotes: Powerful and structured. One of southern Italy's greatest grapes with exceptional aging potential.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, tar, spice
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich stews

tastingNotes: Ancient Campanian grape with citrus and floral notes. Fresh and aromatic.

foodPairings: Seafood; light pasta; fish dishes; appetizers
notes: Falanghina Brut sparkling from Campania. Unusual and delightful

name: Friuli Merlot
tastingNotes: Smooth and approachable. Soft tannins with plum and cherry fruit.
aromaNotes: Plum, cherry, herbs, chocolate
foodPairings: Pasta; grilled meats; medium-aged cheeses

name: Gropnolo Colli di Luni Vermentino
tastingNotes: Coastal Ligurian Vermentino with citrus, herbs, and saline minerality; crisp and aromatic.
aromaNotes: Lemon, grapefruit, Mediterranean herbs, sea spray.
foodPairings: Seafood; pesto pasta; grilled fish; salads.

name: Sangue di Giuda dell’Oltrepò Pavese (Vino Frizzante Dolce)
tastingNotes: Lightly sparkling sweet red with fresh fruit and low alcohol; served chilled.
aromaNotes: Strawberry, cherry, grape must, floral notes.
foodPairings: Desserts; fruit tarts; salumi; casual aperitif.

name: Barbera
tastingNotes: Vibrant acidity with ripe cherry and plum fruit. Smooth texture with balanced structure.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, violet, spice, hints of oak
foodPairings: Pasta with meat sauce; grilled meats; aged cheeses; risotto

name: Barbera
tastingNotes: Vibrant acidity with ripe cherry and plum fruit. Smooth texture with balanced structure.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, violet, spice, hints of oak
foodPairings: Pasta with meat sauce; grilled meats; aged cheeses; risotto

name: Gioia Barbera del Monferrato Brioso
tastingNotes: Lighter mouthfeel despite dark color. High acidity with juicy character. Fresh and vibrant with tangy fruit qualities.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, cherry, plum, violets, dried herbs, fresh red and black berries
foodPairings: Pizza with tomato sauce; pasta with tomato-based sauces; both meat and fish in tomato sauces; rich dark meats; mushrooms; braised greens; everyday Italian fare
notes: Lighter style Barbera meant for early consumption within 2-4 years. 'Brioso' suggests lively character. May contain up to 15% Dolcetto, Freisa, or Grignolino. High acidity and juicy character make it exceptionally food-friendly. Similar to Dolcetto for everyday drinking

name: La Rossa Barbera d'Asti Superiore
oakTreatment: Oak Aged (6-7 months wood + 6 months bottle)
tastingNotes: Medium to full-bodied with firm tannins. Creamy and smooth with racy, spiced finish. Plump and juicy with vibrant tart red fruits.
aromaNotes: Chocolate, cherries, dried strawberries, spices, bark, ripe cherry, raspberry, vanilla, plump blueberries, savory spices
foodPairings: Mixed roasts; boiled meats; stuffed pasta; red meat; roast dishes; aged cheeses; hearty Piedmontese cuisine
notes: Superiore designation requires higher quality and extended aging. Rated 90 James Suckling, 91 Luca Maroni, 92 Wine Enthusiast. 2 Glasses from Gambero Rosso. Serve at 18°C in large balloon or Burgundy glass. Similar to other premium Barbera d'Asti and Barbera d'Alba wines

name: Venere Dolcetto di Ovada
tastingNotes: Dry, fresh and savory with pleasant tannins. Full but elegant with persistent finish and characteristic slightly bitter undertone.
aromaNotes: Red snapdragon flowers, cherry, blackberry, black currant, woody balsamic notes, white pepper, floral and spicy notes
foodPairings: Spaghetti al pomodoro; tagliatelle al pesto; grilled vegetables; simple antipasti; chicken; pork fillet; white meats; light pasta dishes
notes: Fresh Dolcetto from Ovada in southeastern Piemonte. Despite 'Dolcetto' meaning 'little sweet one', the wine is dry with slightly bitter finish. Best one year from harvest, peak within 12 months after. Serve slightly chilled at 16°C with 15 min aeration. Similar to Dolcetto d'Alba

name: Rosa Regale Brachetto d'Acqui
tastingNotes: Sweet and aromatic with delicate effervescence. Fresh and fruity with characteristic rose petal notes. Light and refreshing.
aromaNotes: Rose petals, strawberry, raspberry, red berries, floral notes, sweet spices
foodPairings: Desserts; fresh berries; chocolate; blue cheese; spicy Asian cuisine; fruit tarts
notes: Sweet sparkling red from Piedmont. Produced by Banfi in Montalcino. Serve chilled at 6-8°C. Ideal as dessert wine or aperitif. Similar to Moscato d'Asti in sweetness profile

name: Barbaresco
tastingNotes: Elegant and refined with silky tannins. Complex and age-worthy with great finesse.
aromaNotes: Rose, tar, cherry, leather, truffle, tobacco
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; truffles; aged hard cheeses

tastingNotes: Fresh and fruity with characteristic almond finish. Soft tannins with approachable style.
aromaNotes: Dark cherries, almonds, violets, plums

aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, violet, spice, hints of oak

tastingNotes: Fresh and fruity with characteristic almond finish. Soft tannins with approachable style.
aromaNotes: Dark cherries, almonds, violets, plums

name: Barbaresco
tastingNotes: Mature Barbaresco from a structured vintage; firm tannins with developed complexity and long finish.
aromaNotes: Rose, tar, dried cherry, leather, tobacco, truffle.

name: Barbera

name: L'Avvocata Barbera d'Asti
tastingNotes: Fresh and juicy with well-balanced profile. Round and full-bodied with spicy finish. Dry with hints of minerality.
aromaNotes: Ripe red fruits, black cherries, violet, pomegranate, red plum, red raspberry, rhubarb, cola, ripe berries
foodPairings: Pasta with ragù and rich meat sauces; stewed baby squids with peas; roast beef; aged and semi-aged cheeses; cold cuts and cured meats; meatballs in tomato sauce
notes: From Canelli, Piemonte. Producer's underground cellars ('Cattedrali Sotterranee') are UNESCO World Heritage listed. High natural acidity makes it versatile with food. Serve at 16-18°C (61-64°F). Similar to other premium Barbera d'Asti from traditional producers

name: Dolcetto d'Alba
tastingNotes: Fresh and fruity with characteristic almond finish. Bright acidity with soft tannins. Easy-drinking and food-friendly.
aromaNotes: Dark cherries, almonds, violets, plums, fresh herbs
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta; grilled vegetables; salumi; light meats
notes: Organic certified. Estate bottled from La Morra in Barolo zone. Historic Piedmont producer. Serve slightly chilled. Best consumed young

tastingNotes: Premium Nizza Riserva Barbera with depth and tension; concentrated fruit with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, violet, cocoa, spice.
foodPairings: Braised meats; roast beef; aged cheeses; rich pasta.

name: La Court Nizza Riserva
tastingNotes: Premium Barbera from Nizza DOCG. Powerful and structured with great aging potential.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, chocolate, tobacco, spice
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich stews

name: Le Orme Barbera d'Asti
tastingNotes: Elegant expressiveness of Barbera. Generous on palate with fresh and savory notes on finish. Extreme versatility in gastronomic pairings.
aromaNotes: Red fruits, floral notes
foodPairings: Pasta with meat sauce; grilled meats; aged cheeses; risotto

name: Barbera d'Alba Superiore
tastingNotes: Rich and concentrated with layers of dark fruit. Elegant tannins with long finish.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, chocolate, vanilla, spice
foodPairings: Braised meats; rich pasta dishes; aged hard cheeses; game

name: Dolcetto d'Alba
tastingNotes: Bright and vibrant with crushed dark berries. Fresh finish with chalky texture. Spicy, ripe fruit with roundness and fine tannins.
aromaNotes: Cherries, plums, dark berries, lilacs, red licorice, hints of oak, chocolate, walnut
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta with tomato or cream sauce; mushroom dishes; grilled steak; Piedmont salami; medium-seasoned cheeses; lamb; game
notes: Classic Piemontese Dolcetto from historic producer established 1881. Rated 91 points James Suckling. Best enjoyed slightly chilled (20 min refrigeration). Similar to Barbera d'Alba as an approachable everyday Piedmont red. Meant for young drinking without extensive aging

name: Dolcetto d’Alba
tastingNotes: Fresh, juicy Dolcetto with dark berry fruit and a lightly bitter almond finish; meant for early drinking.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, blueberry, violet, almond, herbs.
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta; charcuterie; roast chicken; aged cheeses.

name: Langhe Nebbiolo
tastingNotes: Nebbiolo in a more approachable Langhe expression with bright acidity and firm structure; gains complexity with short cellaring.
aromaNotes: Rose, red cherry, dried herbs, light tar, spice.
foodPairings: Pasta with ragù; mushroom dishes; roasted meats; aged hard cheeses.

name: Frem Barbera d'Asti
tastingNotes: Dry, frank, sustained and generous with good body. Savory texture with fine tannins and bright acidity. Switches from fruit-forward to savory.
aromaNotes: Wild blackberries, turned earth, chalky minerality, sea salt, sweet spices, dark fruit, intensely vinous
foodPairings: Tajarin pasta with truffle or meat ragù; roasted duck, pork, rabbit; cold cuts with bread and cheese; medium-aged cheeses; game dishes
notes: From Calosso in Piemonte. 'Frem' means 'firm and robust' in Piedmont dialect. Approx. 50,000 bottles produced annually. Similar to other premium Barbera d'Asti wines. The vibrant acidity lifts dishes without dominating. Develops brick hues with age

name: Barbaresco
tastingNotes: Elegant and refined with silky tannins. Complex and age-worthy with great finesse.
aromaNotes: Rose, tar, cherry, leather, truffle, tobacco
foodPairings: Braised meats; game; truffles; aged hard cheeses
notes: Sontino Barbaresco - accessible introduction to the King's younger sibling.; Back label found indicates vintage 2021; updated vintage and added back label

name: Novello
tastingNotes: Italian nouveau-style wine. Light, fruity, for immediate drinking.
aromaNotes: Fresh berries, banana, bubblegum
foodPairings: Light fare; appetizers; roasted chestnuts

aromaNotes: Blackberry, prune, cocoa, vanilla, spice.

notes: vintage/ABV not visible on captured front

name: Triusco Primitivo di Manduria
tastingNotes: Structured Manduria Primitivo with dark fruit and spice; ample body and aging potential.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, licorice, cocoa, spice.
foodPairings: Grilled meats; braised beef; aged cheeses.
notes: 5%) and

name: 62 Anniversario Riserva Primitivo di Manduria
tastingNotes: Iconic rich Primitivo Riserva with plush dark fruit, chocolate, and oak spice.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, cocoa, vanilla, sweet spice.
foodPairings: BBQ; braised meats; aged cheeses; dark chocolate.
notes: 5%), and

name: Fior Fiore Primitivo di Manduria
tastingNotes: Powerful and concentrated from Manduria zone. Velvety texture with long finish.
aromaNotes: Dried fruit, chocolate, coffee, leather, spice
foodPairings: Rich meats; game; aged hard cheeses; dark chocolate
notes: San Marzano cooperative produces excellent Primitivo. Fior Fiore is a premium cuvée

name: Talò Negroamaro
tastingNotes: Southern Italian character with earthy notes. Rustic charm with dark fruit.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, herbs, earth, tobacco
foodPairings: Grilled lamb; orecchiette with broccoli rabe; aged cheeses
notes: San Marzano Talò Negroamaro - classic Salento red

name: Primitivo Salento
tastingNotes: Rich and fruity with jammy character. Warm and generous with spice notes.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, cherry jam, spice, chocolate
foodPairings: Grilled meats; BBQ; spicy dishes; aged cheeses

name: Bruves Negroamaro Salento
tastingNotes: Southern Italian character with earthy notes. Rustic charm with dark fruit.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, herbs, earth, tobacco
foodPairings: Grilled lamb; orecchiette with broccoli rabe; aged cheeses

name: Primovespa Primitivo Salento
tastingNotes: Rich and fruity with jammy character. Warm and generous with spice notes.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, plum, cherry jam, spice, chocolate
foodPairings: Grilled meats; BBQ; spicy dishes; aged cheeses

name: Cannonau di Sardegna
tastingNotes: Structured and warm with silky tannins, fresh acidity, and Mediterranean salinity. Succulent and full-bodied with savory finish.
aromaNotes: Dark berries (wild blackberry), black olive, licorice, Mediterranean scrub herbs, myrtle, black pepper, garrigue
foodPairings: "Roasted Sardinian lamb with rosemary; lamb skewers; venison and game; aged cheeses; cured meats and charcuterie; mushroom risotto; pasta with meat sauce"
notes: Sardinian red from Cannonau (Grenache). One of Italy's oldest grape varieties, believed to have originated in Sardinia. Known for high antioxidant content. Similar to Southern Rhône Grenache and Spanish Garnacha. Serve at 18-20°C in a balloon glass. Allow 15-30 min to breathe

name: Nero d'Avola Sicilia
tastingNotes: Sicily's signature red grape. Rich and fruity with Mediterranean character.
aromaNotes: Plum, cherry, herbs, spice, chocolate
foodPairings: Grilled meats; pasta with meat sauce; aged cheeses; Sicilian cuisine
notes: Madaudo estate, established 1945. No vintage on label

name: Beatrice Nero d’Avola Sicilia
tastingNotes: Sicilian Nero d’Avola in a ripe, fruit-forward style with soft tannins and a savory edge.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, plum, licorice, herbs, spice.
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta with tomato sauce; grilled meats; aged cheeses.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
tastingNotes: Rich and complex with developed flavors. Elegant tannins with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes
notes: Banfi Chianti Classico Riserva from renowned Montalcino producer. Extended barrel aging for complexity

name: Chianti Riserva
tastingNotes: Rich and complex with developed flavors. Elegant tannins with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes
notes: Traditional Chianti Riserva estate

name: Bolgheri Vermentino
tastingNotes: Crisp coastal Tuscan Vermentino with citrus and saline minerality; best young and fresh.
aromaNotes: Lemon, grapefruit, white flowers, Mediterranean herbs, sea spray.
foodPairings: Seafood; grilled fish; salads; aperitif; light pasta.

name: Colle delle More Maremma Toscana
tastingNotes: Coastal Tuscan red with fresh fruit character. Approachable and food-friendly from Maremma.
aromaNotes: Red fruits, Mediterranean herbs, leather, spice
foodPairings: Grilled meats; pasta; Tuscan cuisine; aged cheeses
notes: From Fonteblanda in Grosseto province. Maremma is Tuscany's coastal wine region. Fresh and approachable style

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Rosso
tastingNotes: Toscana Rosso Cabernet blend with ripe dark fruit and oak spice; structured but approachable.
aromaNotes: Blackcurrant, plum, cedar, cocoa, herbs.
foodPairings: Grilled meats; burgers; roast pork; hard cheeses.
notes: back label provides blend and 14.2% ABV

name: Vermentino Costa Toscana
tastingNotes: Crisp Vermentino with citrus, herbs, and coastal salinity; best enjoyed young.
aromaNotes: Lemon, grapefruit, white flowers, sea breeze, herbs.
foodPairings: Seafood; grilled fish; salads; aperitif.
notes: back label shows 12.5% ABV

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
tastingNotes: Rich and complex with developed flavors. Elegant tannins with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes
notes: Riserva from Barberino Tavarnelle

name: Brunello di Montalcino
tastingNotes: Classic Brunello with powerful structure, savory complexity, and long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Sour cherry, dried herbs, leather, tobacco, spice.
foodPairings: Braised beef; lamb; game; aged pecorino.

name: Chianti Trebbio Riserva
tastingNotes: Rich and complex with developed flavors. Elegant tannins with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes
notes: Historic Castello del Trebbio estate near Florence

name: Chianti Riserva
tastingNotes: Rich and complex with developed flavors. Elegant tannins with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes
notes: Estate-bottled Chianti Riserva from Castello di Oliveto

name: Alfeo Bolgheri Superiore
tastingNotes: Structured Bolgheri Superiore style with ripe dark fruit and firm tannins; built for mid-term aging.
aromaNotes: Black cherry, cassis, cedar, tobacco, spice.
foodPairings: Grilled steak; roast lamb; game; aged cheeses.

name: Bolgheri Rosso
grapeVarieties: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc
tastingNotes: Fresh and harmonious with ferrous minerality balanced by softness. Well-integrated tannins with mineral quality and persistent finish.
aromaNotes: Small red fruits, blueberry, pepper, chocolate, licorice, leather, laurel, black cherry, tobacco, oak
foodPairings: Meat tortelli with butter and sage; Bistecca alla Fiorentina; roasted lamb; beef; game (deer, venison); rich pasta dishes
notes: Super Tuscan style blend from prestigious Bolgheri. Aged 14 months in French oak barriques plus 6 months in bottle. Similar to other Bolgheri blends like Ornellaia and Grattamacco. Serve at 16-18°C

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva
tastingNotes: Structured, balanced and intense. Soft and elegant with potential for long aging. Deep complexity develops with cellaring.
aromaNotes: Violet, plum jam, black pepper, dried herbs, leather, tobacco, dark cherries
foodPairings: Aged pecorino and goat cheese; Cinta Senese salumi; egg pasta with meat ragù; wild boar; Bistecca alla Fiorentina (medium-rare); roasted lamb; truffle dishes (if aged 3+ years); 75% dark chocolate
notes: Traditional Tuscan blend using Prugnolo Gentile (local Sangiovese clone). Riserva ages 2 years in large Slavonian oak casks plus 1 year in bottle. Similar to Brunello di Montalcino and Chianti Classico Riserva. Serve at 18°C with hearty Tuscan cuisine

name: Rosso Bolgheri
tastingNotes: Bolgheri-style red with ripe fruit and a polished, savory finish; approachable now with a few years of upside.
aromaNotes: Blackberry, black cherry, spice, subtle oak.
foodPairings: Grilled meats; rich pasta; roast pork; hard cheeses.

name: Chianti
tastingNotes: Fresh cherry and plum fruit with herbal notes. Balanced acidity with food-friendly style.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, violet, dried herbs, leather
foodPairings: Pasta with tomato sauce; grilled meats; Tuscan cuisine; aged cheeses

tastingNotes: Classic Chianti Classico with bright cherry fruit, herbal notes, and food-friendly acidity.
aromaNotes: Cherry, violet, dried herbs, leather.
foodPairings: Pasta; pizza; grilled meats; Tuscan cuisine.
notes: 5%), and

name: Chianti Superiore

aromaNotes: Cherry, violet, dried herbs, leather, earthy notes
foodPairings: Pasta with tomato sauce; grilled meats; aged cheeses; Tuscan cuisine
notes: From Figline e Incisa Valdarno in Tuscany. Superiore designation indicates higher quality standards. Traditional Chianti producer

aromaNotes: Cherry, dried herbs, leather, tobacco, spice.
foodPairings: Braised meats; steak; game; aged pecorino.

name: Chianti
tastingNotes: Fresh cherry and plum fruit with herbal notes. Balanced acidity with food-friendly style.

aromaNotes: Blackcurrant, cherry, cedar, tobacco, spice.
foodPairings: Grilled red meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich pasta.

name: Bolgheri Rosso

aromaNotes: Blackcurrant, cherry, tobacco, cedar, spice
foodPairings: Grilled red meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich pasta dishes

aromaNotes: Cherry, violet, herbs, leather, earthy notes
foodPairings: Tuscan classics; grilled red meats; aged pecorino; pasta with ragù

name: Chianti Classico
tastingNotes: Classic expression from the heart of Chianti. Structured with aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, violet, leather, tobacco, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca alla Fiorentina; roasted meats; game; aged cheeses
notes: Le Chiantigiane cooperative produces quality Chianti Classico

name: Vin Santo del Chianti
tastingNotes: Golden to amber color with ethereal aromatic character. Harmonious and velvety palate. Complex dried fruit and honey notes.
aromaNotes: Dried apricot, honey, nuts, caramel, orange peel, dried figs
foodPairings: Cantucci biscotti; aged cheeses; desserts; foie gras; blue cheese
notes: Traditional Tuscan dessert wine from Chianti zone. Extended aging in small barrels (caratelli). Serve at 10-12°C. From cooperative in Tavarnelle

name: Merlot
tastingNotes: Intense ruby red color with vinous, characteristic aroma. Dry and soft on the palate.
aromaNotes: Red fruits, earthy notes, characteristic vinous aromas
foodPairings: Pasta with meat sauce, salumi, grilled meats
notes: Tuscan Merlot IGT. No vintage visible on label. Approachable and food-friendly style

name: Chianti Riserva
tastingNotes: Rich and complex with developed flavors. Elegant tannins with long aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, spice
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes

name: Chianti Riserva
tastingNotes: Hand-harvested Riserva with floral and fruity character. Elegant tannins with good aging potential.
aromaNotes: Cherry, violet, leather, dried herbs, spice, tobacco
foodPairings: Bistecca; roasted meats; aged cheeses; game; rich pasta dishes
notes: Estate from Lastra a Signa near Florence. Hand-harvested grapes. Riserva designation requires extended aging. Traditional Chianti producer

name: Brunello di Montalcino
tastingNotes: Structured Brunello with firm tannins and high acidity; built for long aging and savory development.
aromaNotes: Cherry, dried herbs, leather, tobacco, spice.
foodPairings: Braised meats; bistecca; game; aged pecorino.

name: Eternauta
tastingNotes: Complex and evolved with depth from dynamic aging. Multiple vintage blend creates layered complexity. Natural winemaking with authentic terroir expression.
aromaNotes: Dried cherry, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, forest floor, balsamic notes, dark fruits, spice, earthy complexity
foodPairings: Aged hard cheeses; wild boar and game; truffle dishes; hearty Tuscan stews; grilled red meats; mushroom risotto
notes: 'Cuvée ad invecchiamento dinamico' - dynamic aging blend of multiple vintages (NV). 'Diverse percezioni di sangiovese' - diverse perceptions of Sangiovese. Similar to solera-style wines. Natural/biodynamic production. Named after Argentine sci-fi comic. Unique cellar-worthy expression

name: Tizzo
tastingNotes: Natural wine character with vibrant fruit and earthy complexity. Unfiltered with authentic expression of terroir. Fresh acidity typical of Sangiovese.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, violet, dried herbs, earthy notes, leather, tobacco, wild berries
foodPairings: Tuscan classics: ribollita, pappa al pomodoro; grilled meats; aged pecorino; wild boar ragù; roasted vegetables; simple pasta dishes
notes: Natural wine from organic/biodynamic Montepulciano estate. Spontaneous fermentation with native yeasts, minimal sulfites, unfiltered. 'Tizzo' means ember/firebrand. Similar to natural Chianti and artisanal Rosso di Montepulciano. Approx 30,000 bottles total production

name: Usta
tastingNotes: Delicate and fruity with pleasant freshness and light saltiness. Crisp mineral finish with soft, refined texture. Bright acidity.
aromaNotes: Raspberry, strawberry, watermelon, red grapefruit, jasmine, white flowers, citrus zest, light herbs
foodPairings: Fresh appetizers and bruschetta; fresh or aged cheeses; fish dishes (salmon, tuna); white meats; light summer fare; Mediterranean salads; seafood
notes: 'L'altra faccia del sangiovese' - the other face of Sangiovese. Natural rosato from organic/biodynamic estate. Direct pressing method with minimal skin contact. Spontaneous fermentation. Similar to Tuscan rosatos from Chianti producers. Best served chilled as an aperitif or with light dishes

name: Imperioso Rosso Toscano
tastingNotes: Authentic Tuscan red with rustic charm. Fresh fruit with earthy notes.
aromaNotes: Cherry, plum, herbs, leather
foodPairings: Pasta; grilled meats; Tuscan cuisine

grapeVarieties: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot

aromaNotes: Black cherry, blackberry, cedar, cocoa, herbs.
foodPairings: Grilled meats; roast pork; hearty pasta; aged pecorino.

notes: From Antinori's Santa Cristina estate in Valdichiana. Traditional vin santo production. Half bottle format

aromaNotes: Black cherry, blackberry, spice, subtle oak.

name: Nambrot
tastingNotes: Rich and concentrated with fine tannins and savory finish. Firm acidity with refined, elegant character. Mid-ruby color.

foodPairings: Traditional Tuscan cuisine; roasted red meats; game; aged hard cheeses; rich pasta dishes with meat ragù; grilled lamb
notes: Demeter certified biodynamic wine from Venerosi Pesciolini family estate. Organic since 2003, biodynamic since 2006. Hand-picked, indigenous yeast fermentation. Rated 93-94 points (Vinous). Similar to other premium Super Tuscans. Named after historical figure. Exceptional aging potential

aromaNotes: Cherry, red berries, almond, violet

foodPairings: Seafood; light fish dishes; appetizers; salads; risotto

name: Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore Valdimezzo
tastingNotes: Refermented on Amarone skins for added richness. Velvety texture with dried fruit hints.
aromaNotes: Cherry, dried fruit, chocolate, spice, vanilla
foodPairings: Braised meats; rich pasta dishes; aged cheeses; hearty stews
notes: Sartori Valdimezzo single vineyard Ripasso

name: Rerum Recioto della Valpolicella Classico
tastingNotes: Sweet and concentrated with dried fruit richness. Velvety texture with balanced sweetness. Complex and elegant.
aromaNotes: Dried cherry, raisin, chocolate, spice, plum jam, coffee
foodPairings: Dark chocolate; blue cheese; desserts; dried fruit; nuts
notes: Sweet red from dried grapes (appassimento). Historic Sartori di Verona producer. Traditional Veronese dessert wine. Serve slightly chilled

name: Rafael Valpolicella Classico Superiore
tastingNotes: Higher quality with more concentration. Structured yet approachable.
aromaNotes: Cherry, dried herbs, almond, spice
foodPairings: Grilled meats; pasta with meat sauce; aged cheeses
notes: Tommasi Rafael is a premium Valpolicella Classico Superiore

name: Valpolicella
tastingNotes: Fresh and fruity everyday red. Light and easy-drinking with cherry fruit. Classic Valpolicella character.
aromaNotes: Cherry, red berries, almond, violet, fresh herbs
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta; light meats; appetizers; casual dining
notes: From renowned Tommasi family estate. Classic entry-level Valpolicella. Serve slightly chilled. Versatile food wine

name: Valpolicella
tastingNotes: Fresh and fruity everyday red. Light and easy-drinking with cherry fruit.
aromaNotes: Cherry, red berries, almond, violet
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta; light meats; appetizers; casual dining

name: Veneto Rosso
tastingNotes: Everyday Veneto red. Approachable and food-friendly.
aromaNotes: Cherry, red berries, herbs
foodPairings: Pizza; pasta; casual dining

name: Vrbanjka
tastingNotes: Regional red from Bela Krajina. Cru Plešivica vineyard designation. Fresh and characterful with local grape varieties.
aromaNotes: Red fruits, herbs, earthy notes, subtle spice
foodPairings: Grilled meats; local cuisine; aged cheeses; charcuterie
notes: From Suklje estate in Bela Krajina, southeastern Slovenia. Cru Plešivica indicates single vineyard. Bela Krajina is known for indigenous varieties. 'Vrbanjka' is a local place name

name: Amfora Rdeče
tastingNotes: Amphora-aged orange wine with skin contact. Complex and textural with oxidative character. Traditional ancient winemaking method.
aromaNotes: Dried apricot, honey, nuts, orange peel, dried herbs, tea, spice
foodPairings: Aged cheeses; charcuterie; rich fish dishes; Asian cuisine; mushroom dishes
notes: Amphora-aged red blend from Goriška Brda, Slovenia

name: Carolina Rdeča
tastingNotes: Quality red blend from Slovenia's premier wine region. Smooth and balanced with ripe fruit character. Cosana I. Classe designation.
aromaNotes: Dark cherry, plum, cassis, herbs, subtle oak, spice
foodPairings: Grilled meats; pasta with meat sauce; aged cheeses; hearty dishes
notes: From Klet Brda cooperative, established 1847. Cosana I. Classe indicates top vineyard classification. Goriška Brda borders Italian Collio. One of Slovenia's most respected producers

name: Goričko Sivi Pinot
tastingNotes: Shapeshifter between rosé, orange wine, and white. Soft and round with ripe orchard fruits and exotic spices. Wildly fresh and long finish with pleasantly bitter tinge.
aromaNotes: Pink grapefruit, rosehip, apricot kernel, cinnamon, white cherry, ginger, blood orange, baharat spice, orange peel, dried goji berry, honeyed floral notes, nectarines
foodPairings: Rich fish dishes; roasted poultry; Asian cuisine (Thai, Vietnamese); aged cheeses; charcuterie; mushroom dishes; vegetarian fare with complex flavors
notes: Slovenian orange wine from Prekmurje region. 30 days skin contact, 2 years barrel aging. Spontaneous fermentation with natural yeasts; unfined and unfiltered. Rated 91 points by Vinous. Similar to Friulian orange wines and Georgian qvevri wines. A creative, minimal-intervention expression

name: Malvazija Dora
tastingNotes: Istrian Malvasia with characteristic coastal minerality. Fresh and aromatic with good structure. Award-winning quality.
aromaNotes: White flowers, stone fruit, citrus, almond, Mediterranean herbs, mineral notes
foodPairings: Seafood; fish dishes; light pasta; risotto; Istrian prosciutto; fresh cheeses
notes: From Slovenian Istria. Decanter 2023 World Wine Awards 89 points. 'Dora' likely refers to a vineyard or cuvée name. Malvazija is the signature white grape of Istria. Similar to Italian Friuli Malvasia

name: Grasica
tastingNotes: Rare Slovenian variety from Vipava. Fresh and aromatic.
aromaNotes: White flowers, citrus, herbs, mineral
foodPairings: Seafood; light appetizers; fresh cheeses
notes: Slovenian Grasica from Burja winery in Vipava Valley. Indigenous variety

name: Vipava
tastingNotes: Slovenian red blend from Vipava Valley. Fresh and characterful with natural winemaking approach.
aromaNotes: Red fruits, herbs, earthy notes, subtle spice
foodPairings: Grilled meats; charcuterie; aged cheeses
notes: Red blend from Burja winery in Slovenia's Vipava Valley

name: Pinela
tastingNotes: Indigenous Slovenian grape. Fresh and mineral with herbal notes.
aromaNotes: Green apple, herbs, mineral, citrus
foodPairings: Seafood; light fish; salads; Istrian prosciutto
notes: Pinela is an indigenous Slovenian grape variety
